title: Lesson 89
paragraph: Transit and pace ensure efficiency in movement. Coordination, gradual progression, and trust create substantial benefits in logistics and operations.

words.meaning: the act of passing through or across
words.example: Goods are in transit to the warehouse.
He made a nasty comment about the work.

words.japaneseMeaning: 知らせることができる
words.example: The staff is informable about all procedures.
The financeful company supported the charity.

words.meaning: able to be collected or assembled
words.example: Information from surveys is gatherable online.

words.japaneseMeaning: 結合する、組み合わせる
words.example: We combined our efforts to complete the task.

words.meaning: to stick together or make sense as a whole
words.example: The ideas in the essay cohere well.

words.meaning: firm belief in reliability or ability
words.example: Team members must have trust in each other.

words.meaning: large in amount, value, or importance
words.example: The project made a substantial impact.
